conclusion: Determine the area of the curved surface through which light exits the semi-cylindrical body.
Refractive index of the material is n = 2, radius of the semi-cylinder is R.
The semi-cylindrical body has a flat rectangular surface and a curved surface.
Light enters vertically through the flat surface and refracts inside the semi-cylinder.
Light refracts according to Snell's Law: n1 sin θ1 = n2 sin θ2.
n1 = 1 (air), n2 = 2 (semi-cylinder), θ1 = 0° (since light enters vertically).
Calculate critical angle θc for total internal reflection: sin θc = n1/n2 = 1/2.
Light exits through the curved surface if incident at an angle less than the critical angle.
Angle θ in the semi-cylinder is measured from the normal to the curved surface.
Angle θ at which light exits is related to the arc length of the curved surface.
Arc corresponding to angle θc = 30° is the region where light exits.
Arc length s of the curved surface is given by s = R θ.
For θ = 30° = π/6 radians, arc length is s = R π/6.
Area S of the curved surface through which light exits is S = s L = R π/6 L.
Final answer: Area S of the part of the cylindrical surface through which light exits is S = π/6 R L.
